titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Paul H. De Kruif papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA157

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-10-17 00:02:30 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Paul H. de Kruif papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Paul H. de Kruif 1890-1971. At RIMR 1920-1922. A bacteriologist and popular writer on medical and scientific topics.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Mrs. de Kruif gave what little she had to the Netherlands Museum in Holland, Michigan (Zip: 49423). This includes the original ms. of Microbe Hunters, and a few other things. As far as she knows, there is no formal catalogue or listing. As far as material relating specifically to Sinclair Lewis and Arrowsmith, she is sure that there is "nothing" in the museum collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for researched. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: correspondence and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily concerning de Kruif 's coming to RIMR (Application for appointment to scientific staff included) and situation arising from de Kruif 's publications involving RIMR.

Includes Simon Flexner and Paul de Kruif 's holographs; 1 item from Jacques Loeb; carbon copy of Oct. 16, 1922 letter by Philip B. Hawk to I. K. Russell about "The vitamin craze article"; an exchange between Simon Flexner and Norman Hapgood (editor of Hearst International).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of various de Kruif publications, some written anonymously; book review by Nellie C. Williams of "Our medicine men" in OPEN DOOR, February 1923. Advertising leaflets from Hearst's International; New York Times and JAMA advertisements of de Kruif 's publications. 1922-1926.

did.unittitle: Photographs of de Kruif and Leon E. A. Gratia of Belgium, ca. 1921 and April 23, 1921
New York Times obituary and biographical note from what appears to be WHO'S WHO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains article "de Kruif: from practitioner to chronicler of science" with material and photographs of RIMR, Simon Flexner, Jacques Loeb, Alexis Carrel, de Kruif and Leon E. A. Gratia from RU Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from de Kruif to Malloch, listing key to characters in S. Lewis Arrowsmith (includes RIMR personnel).
